data.name: Star Citizen
data.body:
---

# Quality will always be our number one goal.

When we initially set out on this journey we looked out at the gaming landscape and asked: can we do better? We continue to ask that question about everything we do. As a result, we will ALWAYS extend timelines or re-do features and content if we do not feel they are up to our standards. The freedom to fight for a new level of quality in game development is what crowd funding has allowed us to do, and we will continue to fight to make sure Star Citizen and Squadron 42 are the best possible games they can be.

# This roadmap focuses on big features, but is not fully exhaustive. 

There are a lot of behind-the-scenes work and smaller tasks that will be happening as well as on-going improvements to existing features. This is also not intended to be a final list, there will potentially be additional features added down the line and features may shift in their projected release.

# The roadmap data is pulled directly from the internal project management database.

In the spirit of transparency, the data found on this page is pulled directly from JIRA, our internal database that we are using to plan and manage the project. Feature progress and release plans will be updated here in an automated fashion, once per week.

# Future work estimates are just that: _estimates_.

All estimates are based on our knowledge and experience but there are many aspects of game development that are impossible to predict because they literally cover uncharted territory. You will see the same estimates we use in our internal planning, but it is important to understand that in many cases (especially with groundbreaking engineering tasks) these estimates are often subject to change due to unforeseen complexity in implementing features.

# Internal schedules, the ones you will now be privy to, tend to have aggressive dates.

This helps to help the team focus and scope their tasks, especially in the case of tech development. Every team needs target dates, so you may see dates adjust when we get more accurate information and understanding of what’s needed to be completed.
 
# The polish phase is always hard to estimate, increasingly so in online and multiplayer situations.

The complexity and the difficulty in testing at a large scale make it harder to reproduce and isolate bugs to fix them. We base our estimates, again, on our experience, but we also know that it’s possible for a single bug to cause a delay of days or weeks when a hundred others might be fixed instantly.
 
# This roadmap doesn’t cover everything being worked on across Cloud Imperium Games.

The roadmap is meant to highlight our aims for the remainder of the year on the Persistent Universe. Although technology is shared between the two games, this does not currently reflect the *Squadron 42* roadmap.
 

## Terminology

The status of each Feature in the roadmap indicates where it is in the development process. Here is a handy list of terms used on each card and their meaning.

|      |                                      |
| ------------------ | ----------------------------------------------- |
| **Scheduled**          | The feature is planned but not in development.
| **In Development**     | The feature is being actively developed.
| **Polish**             | Work is complete and undergoing playtests and QA.
| **Completed**          | The feature is considered complete.
| **Released**            | The feature is shipped as part of a public release.

cards.name: Helmet Polish & Lighting Improvements
cards.description: Improving overall look of helmets and visual fidelity of lighting.
cards.body: These improvements will include updates to the model geometry, make sure characters are well lit inside the helmets, and fix bugs such as incidents where the lights persist even when helmets are not on.

cards.name: Performance Optimization
cards.description: Ongoing performance improvements with specific quarterly goals to increase overall framerate among all PC specs.
cards.body: General optimization and engine improvements to increase stability and performance for the players. This includes continued transition of gameplay systems to Item 2.0 as well as investigation and resolution of possible memory leaks and performance spikes.

cards.name: Ship AI to Subsumption
cards.description: Converting the Ship's AI behavior to work with Subsumption
cards.body: Completing the transition for Ship AI to integrate completely with the Subsumption, allowing them to navigate, react and fight using the Subsumption system. This will consolidate the number of systems for the AI characters, so they are using the same system when piloting a ship as they are when walking around.

cards.name: Preacher Armament Distortion Scattergun
cards.description: Creation and implementation of the ship weapon.
cards.body: Designing and creating Preacher Armament's new distortion scattergun as a ship weapon in the game. This not only includes asset creation, but also animations as well as Design input on weapon balancing.

cards.name: Gallenson Tactical Systems GT-Series
cards.description: Update of the GT-Series line of ship weapons.
cards.body: Updating Gallenson Tactical Systems GT-Series line of ship weapons and implementing into the game. This not only includes asset creation, but also animations as well as Design input on weapon balancing.

cards.name: Gemini R97 Shotgun
cards.description: Creation and implementation of FPS weapon.
cards.body: Designing and creating Gemini's R97 shotgun for use by characters in the game. This not only includes asset creation, but also animations as well as Design input on weapon balancing.

cards.name: Amon & Reese Omnisky
cards.description: Update of the Omnisky line of ship weapons.
cards.body: Updating Amon & Reese's Omnisky line of ship weapons and implementing into the game. This not only includes asset creation, but also animations as well as Design input on weapon balancing.

cards.name: Ship Weapon Balance
cards.description: Ship weapon balance pass to ensure they're performing as expected.
cards.body: Complete a balance pass on ship weapons and missiles so they perform as expected.

cards.name: Visor and HUD Displays
cards.description: Visor and HUD improvements and bug fixes.
cards.body: Various improvements and bug fixes for visor and HUD displays. This includes ensuring the quality and legibility of UI, making it visually appealing and distinct between each manufacturer.

cards.name: Planet Tech Improvements
cards.description: The tech responsible for the generation of planets.
cards.body: Continued work to iterate on the technology that allows the generation of planets and its biomes in order to provide a wider variety of environments for the game.

cards.name: Ship Damage
cards.description: Ship Damage overhaul with improved physics with better explosions and damage shaders.
cards.body: Updating the ship damage technology to allow for higher fidelity explosions, better damage shaders and improved physics.

cards.name: IFCS - Balance/Tuning iteration tasks
cards.description: Improvements to Flight Control System.
cards.body: Continued work on the game's underlying Flight Control System that handles ships and vehicles moving both in atmosphere and in space. Tasks include general improvement, bugfixes and updates to the control algorithm.

cards.name: Personal Manager App
cards.description: Various improvements to the Personal Manager App on mobiGlas.
cards.body: Improvements and bug fixes for the Personal Manager App on mobiGlas, such as the ability to switch between preset loadouts, getting the 3D character model to rotate and ensuring the selected item/weapon is properly framed in the window.

cards.name: Character Customizer
cards.description: The Character Customizer will allow players to customize their avatar.
cards.body: The Character Customizer will allow players to choose from a variety of looks to customize the appearance of their in-game avatar. The variety of customization options will increase over time as we build and add new assets into the game.

cards.name: [Service Beacon] Distress Call
cards.description: Send out a distress signal and allow other players to travel to your position.
cards.body: The initial system that would allow players to call for help. This would create a marker that could be viewed by other players and traveled to. It would also have a mechanic to transfer money between players as a reward.

cards.name: MISC Razor
cards.description: Implementing MISC's long-distance racer, the Razor.
cards.body: Building, implementing, and balancing MISC's long-distance racer, the Razor, as a flight ready ship in the game.

cards.name: Tumbril Cyclone
cards.description: Implementing Tumbril's ground vehicle, the Cyclone.
cards.body: Building, implementing, and balancing the base variant of Tumbril's all-terrain vehicle, the Cyclone, to be piloted in the game.

cards.name: Aopoa Nox Kue
cards.description: Implementing the Kue variant of Aopoa's Nox open-canopy racer.
cards.body: Making this variant of the Nox flight ready for the game. Tasks to achieve this include XML Setup, ensuring that this appears in game terminals, and confirming that all work from the original Nox such as VFX, Audio, and Animation has been correctly converted over.

cards.name: Aegis Reclaimer
cards.description: Implementing the Aegis Reclaimer into the game.
cards.body: Building, implementing, and balancing Aegis' large salvage ship, the Reclaimer, as a flight ready ship in the game.

cards.name: Anvil Terrapin
cards.description: Implementing Anvil Aerospace's Terrapin into the game.
cards.body: Building, implementing, and balancing Anvil's sturdy reconnaissance ship, the Terrapin, as a flight ready ship in the game.

cards.name: Legacy Heavy Outlaw
cards.description: Revising the older legacy Outlaw armor.
cards.body: This feature includes revisiting the old Heavy Outlaw armor unveiled in the initial Star Marine demo and updating it to the current design spec, artistic fidelity and item system.

cards.name: Legacy Light Marine
cards.description: Revising the older legacy Marine armor
cards.body: This feature includes revisiting the old Light Marine armor unveiled in the initial Star Marine demo and updating it to the current design spec, artistic fidelity and item system.

cards.name: Legacy Light Outlaw
cards.description: Revising the older legacy Outlaw armor.
cards.body: This feature includes revisiting the old Light Outlaw armor unveiled in the initial Star Marine demo and updating it to the current design spec, artistic fidelity and item system.

cards.name: Legacy Medium Outlaw
cards.description: Revising the older legacy Outlaw armor.
cards.body: This feature includes revisiting the old Medium Outlaw armor unveiled in the initial Star Marine demo and updating it to the current design spec, artistic fidelity and item system.

cards.name: Legacy Medium Marine
cards.description: Revising the older legacy Marine armor
cards.body: This feature includes revisiting the old Medium Marine armor unveiled in the initial Star Marine demo and updating it to the current design spec, artistic fidelity and item system.

cards.name: Port Olisar Collection
cards.description: Creating the Port Olisar costume sets.
cards.body: Design, creation and implementation of the various clothing sets that would be used by the inhabitants and stores of Port Olisar.

cards.name: Legacy Heavy Marine
cards.description: Revising the older legacy Marine armor
cards.body: This feature includes revisiting the old Heavy Marine armor unveiled in the initial Star Marine demo and updating it to the current design spec, artistic fidelity and item system.

cards.name: Associated Science and Development Distortion Repeater
cards.description: Creation and implementation of new ship weapon.
cards.body: Designing and creating the Associated Science and Development Distortion Repeater gun for use by characters in the game. This not only includes asset creation, but also animations as well as Design input on weapon balancing.

cards.name: Klaus & Werner Demeco
cards.description: Creation and implementation of new FPS weapon.
cards.body: Designing and creating Klaus & Werner's light machine gun for use by characters in the game. This not only includes asset creation, but also animations as well as Design input on weapon balancing.

cards.name: Gemini F55
cards.description: Creation and implementation of new FPS weapon.
cards.body: Designing and creating Gemini's F55 light machine gun for use by characters in the game. This not only includes asset creation, but also animations as well as Design input on weapon balancing.

cards.name: Kastak Arms Scalpel
cards.description: Creation and implementation of new FPS weapon.
cards.body: Designing and creating Kastak Arms Sniper Rifle for use by characters in the game. This not only includes asset creation, but also animations as well as Design input on weapon balancing.

cards.name: Remotely Operated Turrets on Vehicles
cards.description: Functionality for players to operate remote turrets on vehicles.
cards.body: Implementation of functionality allowing players to operate remote turrets on ships and vehicles.

cards.name: Improvements to Manned Turrets on Vehicles
cards.description: Improvements to player-manned turrets on vehicles.
cards.body: Implementation of targeting functionality for player-manned turrets on vehicles.

cards.name: [Flight] AI Behaviors
cards.description: Improving AI flight behaviors and actions.
cards.body: This feature work will perform improve the existing flight AI and develop new and deeper flight behaviors and characteristics for AI pilots.

cards.name: Performance Optimization
cards.description: Ongoing performance improvements with specific quarterly goals to increase overall framerate among all PC specs.
cards.body: General optimization and engine improvements to increase stability and performance for the players. This includes continued transition of gameplay systems to Item 2.0 as well as investigation and resolution of possible memory leaks and performance spikes.

cards.name: Quantum Travel Improvements
cards.description: Improve the overall Quantum Travel experience with upgrades to graphics, audio, and functionality.
cards.body: Improve the overall Quantum Travel experience with upgrades to graphics, audio, and functionality.

cards.name: Item Kiosk Shopping
cards.description: Implementation of shopping kiosks, with an increased variety of available products.
cards.body: Implementation of shopping kiosks, with an increased variety of available products.

cards.name: Economy Polish 3.2
cards.description: Ongoing polish of economy and shopping experiences.
cards.body: Performing an overall polish pass on the economic systems, from commodity trading to item prices to provide a better overall experience for players.

cards.name: Mining on Planetary Bodies
cards.description: Adding the systems needed for a player to extract minerals from planetary bodies.
cards.body: Adding the systems needed for a player to extract minerals from planetary bodies, using the MISC Prospector's mining arm.

cards.name: Groups System
cards.description: Ability to team up with and identify friends, travel in groups, coordinate and share location information, and chat within different groups.
cards.body: Ability to team up with and identify friends, travel in groups, coordinate and share location information, and chat within different groups.

cards.name: Quantum Linking
cards.description: Adding the ability to link with other players ships, allowing group Quantum Travel.
cards.body: Adding the ability to link with other players ships, allowing group Quantum Travel.

cards.name: Ship Persistence Improvements
cards.description: Improvements to the core system responsible for persisting ship records on the PU.
cards.body: Improvements to the core system responsible for persisting ship records on the PU. This system enables many features including persistent damage, ship variables, and ship consumables.

cards.name: PMA / VMA Improvements
cards.description: Improve the visual presentation, functionality, and usability of the mobiGlas apps.
cards.body: Improve the visual presentation, functionality, and usability of the mobiGlas apps.

cards.name: Item 2.0 Ship Systems & Weapons - Power Allocation
cards.description: Ship component functionality, allowing for upgrades as well as degradation.
cards.body: Functionality for ship components, allowing for weapons and other items to overheat and be overclocked, as well as the ability to configure shield generators, power plants, weapons, and other systems to meaningfully affect ship performance.

cards.name: Aegis Avenger Stalker Revision
cards.description: Revising the Aegis Avenger Stalker
cards.body: Implementing and balancing the updated model of the Aegis Avenger Stalker as a flight ready ship in the game.

cards.name: Anvil Hurricane
cards.description: Implementing the Anvil Hurricane into the game.
cards.body: Building, implementing, and balancing Anvil's fast weapon ship, the Hurricane, as a flight ready ship in the game.

cards.name: Aegis Avenger Titan Revision
cards.description: Revising the Aegis Avenger Titan.
cards.body: Implementing and balancing the updated model of the Aegis Avenger Titan as a flight ready ship in the game.

cards.name: Aegis Avenger Warlock Revision
cards.description: Revising the Aegis Avenger Warlock.
cards.body: Implementing and balancing the updated model of the Aegis Avenger Warlock as a flight ready ship in the game.

cards.name: Origin 600i
cards.description: Implementing the Origin 600i into the game.
cards.body: Building, implementing, and balancing Origin's new luxury ship, the 600i, as a flight ready ship in the game.

cards.name: Aegis Eclipse
cards.description: Implementing the Aegis Eclipse into the game.
cards.body: Building, implementing, and balancing Aegis' new bomber, the Eclipse, as a flight ready ship in the game.

cards.name: Vanduul Blade
cards.description: Implementing the Vanduul Blade fighter into the game.
cards.body: Building, implementing, and balancing the feared Vanduul light fighter, military designation Blade, as a flight ready ship in the game.

cards.name: Mission Giver: Recco Battaglia
cards.description: Creation and implementation of a mission giver character.
cards.body: Creating a new mission giver to add to the Levski location. This includes concepting with the character team, creation of the character's clothing/props and environment, capturing performance/lines, solving the animation and audio files for implementation into the engine, creating the Behavior tree, and hooking up mission content for this character. This task will also include the creation of any text needed to accompany their mission.

cards.name: Hurston Moons - Ariel
cards.description: Building and populating Ariel
cards.body: The creation and implementation of Ariel, including constructing outposts and populating the moon surfaces. *This* *feature* *is* *dependent* *upon* *implementation* *of* *Object* *Container* *Streaming.*

cards.name: Hurston Moons - Magda
cards.description: Building and populating Magda
cards.body: The creation and implementation of Magda, including constructing outposts and populating the moon surfaces. *This* *feature* *is* *dependent* *upon* *implementation* *of* *Object* *Container* *Streaming.*

cards.name: Hurston Moons - Ita
cards.description: Building and populating Ita
cards.body: The creation and implementation of Ita, including constructing outposts and populating the moon surfaces. *This* *feature* *is* *dependent* *upon* *implementation* *of* *Object* *Container* *Streaming.*

cards.name: Hurston Moons - Aberdeen
cards.description: Building and populating Aberdeen
cards.body: The creation and implementation of Aberdeen, including constructing outposts and populating the moon surfaces. *This* *feature* *is* *dependent* *upon* *implementation* *of* *Object* *Container* *Streaming.*

cards.name: Mission Giver: Clovus Darneely
cards.description: Creation of the new Mission Giver, Clovus Darneely
cards.body: Creating a new mission giver to add to the Lorville location. This includes concepting with the character team, creation of the character's clothing/props and environment, capturing performance/lines, solving the animation and audio files for implementation into the engine, creating the Behavior tree, and hooking up mission content for this character. This task will also include the creation of any text needed to accompany their mission. *This* *feature* *is* *dependent* *upon* *implementation* *of* *Object* *Container* *Streaming.*

cards.name: RSI Odyssey Flightsuit Rework
cards.description: Revising the existing RSI Flightsuit.
cards.body: Updating the RSI Odyssey flightsuit to the current artistic fidelity.

cards.name: Virgil TrueDef-Pro Armor
cards.description: Creating the Virgil TrueDef-Pro armor set.
cards.body: Design, creation and implementation of the Virgil TrueDef-Pro armor set.

cards.name: Hurston Clothing Collection
cards.description: Creating the Hurston costume sets.
cards.body: Design, creation and implementation of the various clothing sets that would be used by the inhabitants and stores of Hurston. *This* *feature* *is* *dependent* *upon* *implementation* *of* *Object* *Container* *Streaming.*

cards.name: Small Rest Stops
cards.description: Implementing the base version of rest stop stations
cards.body: Creating and implementing the rest stop stations that players will be able to visit during long flights. This will include installing stores, ATC, and character work. *This* *feature* *is* *dependent* *upon* *implementation* *of* *Object* *Container* *Streaming.*

cards.name: Lorville Landing Zone
cards.description: Creating the city of Lorville on Hurston.
cards.body: Creation of the primary landing zone, Lorville, on Hurston, as well as populating the city with NPCs, Missions and Stores. *This* *feature* *is* *dependent* *upon* *implementation* *of* *Object* *Container* *Streaming.*

cards.name: Hurston Planet
cards.description: Creating the planet Hurston.
cards.body: The creation and implementation of the planet Hurston, including points of interests positioned around the planet. *This* *feature* *is* *dependent* *upon* *implementation* *of* *Object* *Container* *Streaming.*

cards.name: VoIP & FoIP Integration
cards.description: Add Voice Over IP to the Chat System and Face Over IP to the game.
cards.body: Add Voice Over IP to the Chat System and Face Over IP to the game.

cards.name: Network Bind Culling
cards.description: Network code fixes to improve performance.
cards.body: This work aims to help improve performance in multiplayer by cutting down the number of entities that exist on clients. Entities too far from a player will be removed from the local client, and when the player moves or the server otherwise detects new entities entering the player's range they will be added to the client. Because clients will then only consider updating entities that are near to them the overall CPU load will be reduced and performance should improve.

cards.name: Network Entity Streaming
cards.description: Assisting Object Container Streaming for Multiplayer
cards.body: Restructuring how the network code handles entity spawning and binding to allow for asynchronous streaming.

cards.name: [Object Container Streaming] Code Conversion
cards.description: Code conversion of legacy Lua to improve performance.
cards.body: Foundational work for object container streaming, converting all legacy Lua code to C++ for improved performance and greater flexibility for multi-threading.

cards.name: [Object Container Streaming] GameObjectExtensions Conversion
cards.description: GameObjectExtensions conversions to improve performance.
cards.body: Foundational work for object container streaming, converting all remaining GameObjectExtensions so that they no longer use the script table. This will allow for improved performance and greater multi-threading flexibility.

cards.name: [Object Container Streaming] Asynchronous Background Spawning
cards.description: Rework of game systems to move more spawning to the background to reduce stalls.
cards.body: Foundational work for object container streaming, reworking various game systems to trigger more entity spawns in the background, relieving spawning pressure on the main thread and leading to fewer stalls.

cards.name: Ship System Degradation
cards.description: Ship component functionality, allowing for upgrades as well as degradation.
cards.body: Functionality for upgradable ship components, implementing wear and degradation causing reduced performance and misfire events.

cards.name: Weapon System Refactor
cards.description: Overhauling and fine-tuning the current weapon system.
cards.body: A general overhaul to fine-tune and improve various components of the current weapon system.

cards.name: Object Container Streaming
cards.description: Object Container Streaming considerably expands the playable game area and increases performance.
cards.body: At its core, Object Container Streaming allows Star Citizen to create our Universe.  We will no longer be restrained by the physical memory on your PC and will be able to stream in new environments, locations and ships seamlessly as you approach. This will also be one of the biggest wins for increased performance as your graphics memory will no longer be overloaded.  This work requires that a handful of other Object Container Streaming prerequisites be completed.

cards.name: Performance Optimization
cards.description: Ongoing performance improvements with specific quarterly goals to increase overall framerate among all PC specs.
cards.body: General optimization and engine improvements to increase stability and performance for the players. This includes continued transition of gameplay systems to Item 2.0 as well as investigation and resolution of possible memory leaks and performance spikes.

cards.name: Environmental Blending Shader
cards.description: A shader that allows smoother blending of dirt, ice, sand, and organic matter onto objects.
cards.body: Development of a multilayered shader for objects that supports dirt, sand, ice, and organic matter, and allowing the object to believably blend in with any environment on the surfaces of planets and moons.

cards.name: Scramble Race Missions
cards.description: Designing and implementing Scramble Race missions.
cards.body: Designing and implementing Scramble Race missions. The Scramble Race is a mission type that can occur in space or on the ground which sees racers battling to be the first to reach a series of randomly spawned checkpoints. Each race is designed to bring racers into conflict, eliminating competitors by any means is encouraged.

cards.name: Improvements to Retrieval and Delivery missions
cards.description: Improvements to Retrieval and Delivery Missions
cards.body: Delivery missions have been the first to be converted to modular pieces of logic, allowing pick-up and drop-offs to be added into any mission in a matter of minutes. Players will notice that the delivery items will always correlate sensibly to the locations they are being delivered to thanks to the development of data sets which enable us to create relationships between data. Finally, general delivery missions will benefit from new automated lockers which will leave the admin officers free for station-specific deliveries.

cards.name: FPS Combat Missions
cards.description: Implementing FPS AI for combat missions
cards.body: Implementing FPS Combat Missions to allow for players to engage with enemy targets on the ground or in ships to add an action element to some of the missions.

cards.name: [Object Container Streaming] Background Spawning
cards.description: Allows entities to spawn from background threads without introducing stalls.
cards.body: Foundational work for object container streaming, allowing entities to spawn from background threads so that vehicles or object containers can be spawned with minimal stalling.

cards.name: Asteroid Mining
cards.description: Adding the systems needed for a player to extract minerals from asteroids.
cards.body: Implementation of the systems needed for a player to extract minerals from free floating asteroids, as well as from rocks on the surfaces of larger asteroids.

cards.name: Improvements to Mining on Planetary Bodies
cards.description: Improving surface mining on planetary bodies.
cards.body: Upgrades to surface mining on planetary bodies with improvements to UI and general functionality.

cards.name: Shipboard Ping & Scanning
cards.description: Extend Ping and Scanning to much larger distances and expand information received from Scanning vehicles.
cards.body: Extend shipboard Ping and Scanning to much larger distances, differentiate Ping behavior per signature type, and expand information received from Scanning vehicles.

cards.name: Transit Systems
cards.description: Improvement to Ingress/Egress Systems.
cards.body: Improvements to systems that allow players to transfer between various map sections such as doors, elevators, and airlocks.

cards.name: Kastak Arms Karna
cards.description: Creation and implementation of a new FPS weapon.
cards.body: Designing and creating the Kastak Arms' Karna assault rifle for use by characters in-game. The work includes asset creation, passes by numerous departments, and Design input on weapon balance.

cards.name: Hurston Dynamics Dominance Series
cards.description: Creation and implementation of the ship weapon.
cards.body: Designing and creating the new Hurston Dynamics Dominance series ship weapons to implement in the game. This not only includes asset creation, but also animations as well as Design input on weapon balancing.

cards.name: Hurston Dynamics Attrition Series
cards.description: Creation and implementation of the ship weapon.
cards.body: Designing and creating the new Hurston Dynamics Attrition series ship weapon to implement in the game. This not only includes asset creation, but also animations as well as Design input on weapon balancing.

cards.name: [Flight] Improved AI Behaviors
cards.description: Further improvements to Flight AI behaviors.
cards.body: Further improvements to the existing flight AI that will continue to develop new and deeper flight behaviors and characteristics for AI pilots.

cards.name: Arena Commander and Star Marine REC Rentals
cards.description: Implementation of REC Rental in Arena Commander and Star Marine.
cards.body: Adding the ability to rent ships, items and FPS weapons from the Main Menu with REC, for use in Arena Commander and Star Marine.

cards.name: Groups System Improvements
cards.description: Implement new mobiGlas and Visor Chat Systems Features and UI, and remove Legacy Group System and interface with new backend Chat Systems.
cards.body: Implement new mobiGlas and Visor Chat Systems Features and UI, and remove Legacy Group System and interface with new backend Chat Systems.

cards.name: Improvements to Manned and Remote Turrets on Vehicles
cards.description: Further improvements to player-manned and remote turrets on vehicles including input controls and feature toggles.
cards.body: Further improvements to player-manned and remote turrets on vehicles including input controls and feature toggles.

cards.name: No-Fly Zones
cards.description: Adding no-fly zones.
cards.body: Adding no-fly zones to some areas of the PU for logistical reasons, and enhanced intrigue. *This* *feature* *is* *dependent* *upon* *implementation* *of* *Object* *Container* *Streaming.*

cards.name: Item Kiosk Shopping Improvements
cards.description: Improvements to the Item Kiosks shopping experience.
cards.body: Further improvements to Item Kiosk shopping experience, including polishing item previews, adding item comparison, selling functionality, and a general usability upgrades.

cards.name: [FPS Combat] Movement Smoothing
cards.description: Implementing smooth and appropriate movement animation.
cards.body: Improvements to AI movement animation, making certain actions smoother, in particular performing large direction changes, transitioning in and out of cover, and avoiding other characters.

cards.name: [FPS Combat] First Reactions
cards.description: Implement initial reaction behaviors relating to FPS combat.
cards.body: Implementing behavior for first reactions to different events. Ranging from nearby footsteps to grenades going off close-range.

cards.name: [FPS Combat] Multiple Enemy Combat Behaviors
cards.description: Implementing Multiple Enemy Combat Behaviors for FPS Combat.
cards.body: Implementing and iterating on combat group behavior, such as multiple AI reacting to new circumstances together, target coordination, suppressive fire for flanking, and fighting from multiple cover locations.

cards.name: [FPS Combat] Search Behavior
cards.description: Implement varying search behaviors.
cards.body: Making the AI search contextually relevant to different events. (gunshots, explosion, enemy seen etc.) and implementing search behaviors for different alert levels (slightly suspicious to combat search).

cards.name: Consolidated Outland Mustang Beta
cards.description: Implementing the revised version of the Mustang pathfinder into the game.
cards.body: All of the tasks associated with updating and implementing the revised version of Consolidated Outland's pathfinder variant of the Mustang and getting it into the game.

cards.name: Aegis Hammerhead
cards.description: Implementing Aegis' capital support ship, the Hammerhead.
cards.body: Building, implementing, and balancing Aegis' patrol ship, the Hammerhead, as a flight-ready ship in the game.

cards.name: Tumbril Cyclone-AA
cards.description: Implementing the anti-aircraft variant of the Cyclone into the game.
cards.body: Tasks associated with the creation, implementation, and balancing of the Cyclone-AA, Tumbril's variant of the popular ground vehicle designed to protect ground troops against airborne targets.

cards.name: Tumbril Cyclone-RC
cards.description: Implementing the racing variant of the Cyclone into the game.
cards.body: Tasks associated with building, implementing, and balancing of the Cyclone-RC, Tumbril's racing variant of the Cyclone, to get it playable in game.

cards.name: Tumbril Cyclone-TR
cards.description: Implementing the combat variant of the Cyclone into the game.
cards.body: Tasks associated with building, implementing, and balancing the Cyclone-TR, Tumbril's variant of the popular ground vehicle used by military and security forces around the 'verse.

cards.name: Consolidated Outland Mustang Gamma/Omega Revision
cards.description: Implementing the revised version of the Mustang racing variants into the game.
cards.body: All of the tasks associated with updating and implementing the revised version of Consolidated Outland's racing variants of the Mustang and getting them into the game.

cards.name: Consolidated Outland Mustang Delta Revision
cards.description: Implementing the revised version of the Mustang fighter variant into the game.
cards.body: All of the tasks associated with updating and implementing the revised version of Consolidated Outland's light fighter variant of the Mustang and getting it into the game.

cards.name: RSI Constellation Phoenix
cards.description: Implementing the revised Constellation Phoenix into the game.
cards.body: Implementing and balancing RSI's luxury variant of the Constellation, the Phoenix, as a flight ready ship in the game.

cards.name: Consolidated Outland Mustang Alpha
cards.description: Implementing the revised version of the base Mustang into the game.
cards.body: Implementing and balancing the updated base model of the Consolidated Outland Mustang to make it flight ready in the game.

cards.name: Tumbril Cyclone-RN
cards.description: Implementing the reconnaissance variant of the Cyclone into the game.
cards.body: Tasks associated with the creation, implementation, and balancing of the Cyclone-RN, Tumbril's variant of the popular ground vehicle designed to quietly scan ground targets.

cards.name: Mission Giver: Wallace Klim
cards.description: Creation and implementation of a mission giver character.
cards.body: Creating a new mission giver to add to the Levski location. This includes concepting with the character team, creation of the character's clothing/props and environment, capturing performance/lines, solving the animation and audio files for implementation into the engine, creating the Behavior tree, and hooking up mission content for this character. This task will also include the creation of any text needed to accompany their mission.

cards.name: Lorville Business District
cards.description: Creating Lorville's core Business District.
cards.body: Creation of Lorville's core Business District , including populating the area with NPCs, shops, mission, etc. *This* *feature* *is* *dependent* *upon* *implementation* *of* *Object* *Container* *Streaming.*

cards.name: ArcCorp Moon - Lyria
cards.description: Building and populating Lyria
cards.body: The creation and implementation of ArcCorp's moon Lyria, including constructing outposts and populating the moon surfaces. *This* *feature* *is* *dependent* *upon* *implementation* *of* *Object* *Container* *Streaming.*

cards.name: ArcCorp Moon - Wala
cards.description: Building and populating Wala
cards.body: The creation and implementation of ArcCorp's moon Wala, including constructing outposts and populating the moon surfaces. *This* *feature* *is* *dependent* *upon* *implementation* *of* *Object* *Container* *Streaming.*

cards.name: Gas Cloud Tech
cards.description: Adding underlying tech that will allow rendering of volumetric cloud effects.
cards.body: Implementation of the underlying tech that will allow rendering of volumetric effects such as asteroid field dust, comet tails, etc.

cards.name: Projectile Manager
cards.description: Enhancing projectile systems through advanced physics.
cards.body: Implement physics systems that will improve projectile functionality and realism in-game.

cards.name: FPS Ping & Scanning
cards.description: Adding Scanning functionality to FPS Gameplay
cards.body: Transfer of the Scanning and Ping system to players on foot. The initial implementation of this feature will include discovering active and temp contacts, generating blobs for distant entities, and the ability to scan entities for additional info.

cards.name: Hard Surface Shader Improvements
cards.description: Improvements to the Surface Shader
cards.body: Implementing improvements to the hard surface and organic shaders, allowing for enhanced environmental detail.

cards.name: Quantum Travel Improvements
cards.description: Further Improvements to the Quantum Travel System
cards.body: Continue to improve the Quantum Travel mechanic with upgrades to UI,  interaction, and spline jumps.

cards.name: Origin 600i Touring Module
cards.description: Implementing the Origin 600i Touring variant into the game.
cards.body: Creating the Touring variant of Origin's 600i luxury ship, and all balancing requirements needed to make it flight ready in the game.

cards.name: Origin 300i Rework
cards.description: Implementing the revised 300i into the game.
cards.body: Implementing and balancing the updated model of the Origin 300i as a flight ready ship in the game.

cards.name: Origin 315p Rework
cards.description: Implementing the revised 315p into the game.
cards.body: Implementing and balancing the revised model of the Origin 315p as a flight ready ship in the game.

cards.name: Origin 325a Rework
cards.description: Implementing the revised 325a into the game.
cards.body: Implementing and balancing the revised model of the Origin 325a as a flight ready ship in the game.

cards.name: Origin 350R Rework
cards.description: Implementing the revised 350R into the game.
cards.body: Implementing and balancing the revised model of the Origin 350R as a flight ready ship in the game.

cards.name: Shipjacker Armor
cards.description: Creating renegade outlaw armor pieces.
cards.body: Creating and implementing armor that consist of a wilder, more anarchic combination of styles.

cards.name: MISC Reliant Kore Improvements
cards.description: Implementing the revised Reliant Kore into the game.
cards.body: Implementing and balancing the updated base model of MISC's Reliant series to make it flight-ready in the game. Work on this task will include reworking the ship's cargo area, updating the landing gear, revising the nozzle system, and making adjustments to the ramp.

cards.name: ArcCorp Planet
cards.description: Creation of the planet ArcCorp.
cards.body: The design, creation and implementation of the sprawling urban planet, ArcCorp, including points of interest around the planet. *This* *feature* *is* *dependent* *upon* *implementation* *of* *Object* *Container* *Streaming.*

cards.name: Area18 Landing Zone
cards.description: Incorporating the Area18 Landing Zone on ArcCorp.
cards.body: Incorporating Landing Control Area18, landing zone on the planet ArcCorp and one of the main commercial ports for interplanetary traffic for the surrounding region. This work includes populating the city with NPCs, Missions, and Stores. *This* *feature* *is* *dependent* *upon* *implementation* *of* *Object* *Container* *Streaming.*

cards.name: Kastak Arms Ravager-212 Twin
cards.description: Creation and implementation of a new FPS weapon.
cards.body: Designing and creating Kastak Arms' dual barrel shotgun for use by characters in-game. This includes asset creation, passes by numerous departments, and Design input on weapon balance.

cards.name: Joker Engineering Suckerpunch Cannon Revision
cards.description: Updating the ship weapon to latest version.
cards.body: Covers all the tasks associated with updating Joker Engineering's Suckerpunch Cannon series (S1-3) and implementing the revised versions in-game.

cards.name: Behring Sawbuck Repeater Revision
cards.description: Implementing the revised version of the Sawbuck Repeater (S1-3) in-game.
cards.body: Covers all the tasks associated with updating Behring's Sawbuck Repeater series (S1-3) and implementing the revised versions in-game.

cards.name: Playable Female Characters
cards.description: Adding Female Humans as Playable characters and NPCs.
cards.body: Implementing the models, animations and items to allow for Players to select a female avatar, as well as update female NPCs in the various locations.

cards.name: Performance Optimization
cards.description: Ongoing performance improvements with specific quarterly goals to increase overall framerate among all PC specs.
cards.body: General optimization and engine improvements to increase stability and performance for the players. This includes continued transition of gameplay systems to Item 2.0 as well as investigation and resolution of possible memory leaks and performance spikes.

cards.name: Procedural City Rendering Performance
cards.description: Performance improvements for Procedural City Rendering.
cards.body: Development of technology that allows large procedural cities to render more efficiently in engine regardless of distance from the camera. *This* *feature* *is* *dependent* *upon* *implementation* *of* *Object* *Container* *Streaming.*

cards.name: [FPS Combat] Stealth
cards.description: Adding Stealth Gameplay to Behavior
cards.body: NPC behaviors will allow the player to approach an encounter using stealth tactics and also allow NPCs to react appropriately.

cards.name: [Flight] Quantum & Strafing
cards.description: Increased abilities for AI Pilots.
cards.body: This batch of improvements will allow AI Pilots to use quantum navigation, provide more updates to the IFCS flight mode, and allow AI to use basic scanning mechanics to possibly detect stealthed ships.

cards.name: Anvil Hawk
cards.description: Implementing Anvil's light fighter, the Hawk, into the game.
cards.body: Building, implementing, and balancing Anvil's light fighter, the Hawk, as a flight-ready ship in the game.

cards.name: MISC Freelancer MAX
cards.description: Implementing the revised models of the Freelancer MAX into the game.
cards.body: Implementing and balancing the revised version of MISC's Freelancer hauling variant and making it to flight ready in the game.

cards.name: MISC Freelancer DUR
cards.description: Implementing the revised models of the Freelancer DUR into the game.
cards.body: Implementing and balancing the revised version of MISC's Freelancer exploring variant and making it to flight ready in the game.

cards.name: MISC Freelancer MIS
cards.description: Implementing the revised model of the MISC Freelancer MIS into the game.
cards.body: Implementing and balancing the revised version the Freelancer's gunship variant, the MIS, and making it flight ready in the game.

cards.name: DNA Face Customization
cards.description: Comprehensive facial customization for characters.
cards.body: Design and implementation of a bespoke system allowing for comprehensive facial customization for in-game characters.

cards.name: Reputation/Law System v1
cards.description: Designing and implementing the Reputation and Law system.
cards.body: Designing and implementing the initial iteration of the Reputation and Law system, allowing for localized crime ratings and reputations, along with integrated location-based missions.

cards.name: Origin m50 Improvements
cards.description: Implementing the revised m50 into the game.
cards.body: Implementing and balancing the reworked base model of Origin's m50 racer to make it flight-ready in the game. Work on this task will include improvements to landing gear compression and updating the UI metrics in the cockpit to improve pilot experience.

cards.name: Kruger P52 Merlin Improvements
cards.description: Implementing the revised version of the P52 Merlin into the game.
cards.body: Implementation and balancing of the improvements made to Kruger's P52 Merlin snub fighter to make it flight-ready in the game. Work on this task will include general improvements to the landing gear compression.

cards.name: Salvage v1
cards.description: The ability to collect material from ship hulls.
cards.body: Designing and implementing mechanics required for players to be able to strip material from a ship's hull. This system will be designed to accommodate players who are on foot or in a ship.  The player will have to scan the environment to find salvageable debris. Once harvested, unrefined materials can be sold at a kiosk.

cards.name: Gemini S71
cards.description: Creation and implementation of a new FPS weapon.
cards.body: Designing and creating Gemini's S71 assault rifle for use by characters in-game. Work covers concept completion, asset creation, passes by numerous departments, and Design input on weapon balance.

cards.name: Gallenson Tactical Systems GT-870 Tarantula Revision
cards.description: Updating the ship weapon to latest version.
cards.body: Covers all the tasks associated with updating Gallenson Tactical Systems' GT-870 Tarantula series of ballistic cannons (S1-3) and implementing the revised versions in-game.

cards.name: Parallel Network Jobs
cards.description: Increased network multithreading
cards.body: Moving packet receive processing into the job system so that the server can handle a greater number of connections. This system should allow the game to increase player count per server beyond the limitations of the current tech.

cards.name: Kastak Arms Coda
cards.description: Creation and implementation of a new FPS weapon.
cards.body: Designing and creating Kastak Arms' Coda ballistic pistol for use by characters in-game.  The work includes asset creation, passes by numerous teams, and Design input on weapon balance.

cards.name: Lobby Refactor
cards.description: Refactor of lobby/session management ready for server meshing
cards.body: This will lay the groundwork for server migration technology that will allow us to connect multiple servers and clients in the same game session. As this task is closely aligned to server meshing, there won't be an immediate observable benefit to the tech until all server meshing work is complete.

cards.name: Kastak Arms Firestorm
cards.description: Creation and implementation of a new FPS weapon.
cards.body: Designing and creating Kastak Arms' microwave cannon for use by characters in-game. This includes concept completion, asset creation, passes by numerous departments, and Design input on weapon balance.

cards.name: Performance Optimization
cards.description: Ongoing performance improvements with specific quarterly goals to increase overall framerate among all PC specs.
cards.body: General optimization and engine improvements to increase stability and performance for the players. This includes continued transition of gameplay systems to Item 2.0 as well as investigation and resolution of possible memory leaks and performance spikes.

cards.name: Banu Defender
cards.description: Implementing the Defender into the game.
cards.body: Building, implementing, and balancing the Banu fighter as a flight ready ship in the game.

cards.name: MISC Reliant Tana
cards.description: Implementing the combat variant of the Reliant into the game.
cards.body: Tasks associated with building, implementing, and balancing of the Reliant Tana, MISC's combat variant of the Reliant, to get it playable in game.

cards.name: MISC Reliant Sen
cards.description: Implementing the research variant of the Reliant into the game.
cards.body: Tasks associated with building, implementing, and balancing of the Reliant Sen, MISC's research variant of the Reliant, to get it playable in game.

cards.name: MISC Reliant Mako
cards.description: Implementing the media variant of the Reliant into the game.
cards.body: Tasks associated with the creation, implementation, and balancing of the Reliant Mako, MISC's variant designed to gather all the latest events for the spectrum.

cards.name: RSI Constellation Taurus
cards.description: Implementing the revised model of the Constellation Taurus into the game.
cards.body: Implementing and balancing RSI's hauling variant of the Constellation, the Taurus, as a flight ready ship in the game.

cards.name: [Service Beacon] Escort
cards.description: Pay another player to escort you to a different location.
cards.body: By integrating Quantum Linking, the new Escort beacons will improve Combat Assistance by allowing your hired guns to more readily accompany you.

cards.name: Persistent Item Cache Refactor
cards.description: Refactoring backend tech for scalability and optimization.
cards.body: This foundational work includes refactoring backend tech for maximum scalability and optimization.

cards.name: Insurance Service Refactor
cards.description: Improving the backend manageability and scalability of Insurance Services
cards.body: Improve the backend manageability and scalability of insurance services, building off of the underlying persistent item cache tech.

cards.name: Ping & Scanning Improvements
cards.description: Add Items Targeting, Signatures Enhancements, and Mission-Specific Support to the Scanning System.
cards.body: Add Items Targeting, Signatures Enhancements (such as obfuscation and distortion), and Mission-Specific Support to the Scanning System.

cards.name: Physical Inventories
cards.description: Implementing a localized physical inventory system.
cards.body: Design and implementation of a physical localized inventory system, with persistence and limitations, allowing for a more immersive and realistic experience.

cards.name: Guilds System
cards.description: Adding the initial iteration of the Guilds System.
cards.body: Design and implementation of the initial iteration of the Guilds system, which will enable localized guilds, specialized missions and mission givers, and guild membership options.

cards.name: Kruger Intergalactic P72 Archimedes
cards.description: Adding Kruger Intergalactic's snub craft, the P72 Archimedes
cards.body: Building, implementing, and balancing Kruger's snub craft, the Archimedes, as a flight-ready ship in the game.

cards.name: MaxOx Neutron Repeaters
cards.description: Creation and implementation of the new ship weapon.
cards.body: Designing and creating the new MaxOx NN Series Neutron Repeater ship weapons to implement in the game. This not only includes asset creation, but also animations as well as Design input on weapon balancing.

cards.name: Repair v1
cards.description: Adding the ability for players to physically repair a ship's exterior.
cards.body: The mechanics necessary for players to traverse to the exterior of larger ships to perform spot repairs on damaged hulls.

cards.name: CommArray Revision
cards.description: Updating the CommArrays in the Universe
cards.body: Creating and implementing revisions to the CommArray stations positioned around the universe. These not only facilitate the ability to transfer data but also provide ECN coverage to report any security violations.

cards.name: Ship to Ship Refuel v1
cards.description: Adding the ability for players in certain ships to refuel other ships.
cards.body: Designing and implementing the mechanics needed to allow for players in specific ships to sell fuel to other players by connecting with them and directly providing fuel to their ship.

cards.name: Klaus & Werner Lumin V
cards.description: Creation and implementation of the new FPS weapon.
cards.body: Designing and creating Klaus & Werner's submachine gun for use by characters in-game. This includes asset creation, passes by numerous departments, and Design input on weapon balance.

cards.name: Origin 890 Jump
cards.description: Implementing the Origin 890 into the game.
cards.body: Building, implementing, and balancing Origin's luxury ship, the 890 Jump, as a flight ready ship in the game.

cards.name: Service Beacon Improvements
cards.description: Expanded Service Beacon features, including new contract types, filters, and interactions.
cards.body: Expanded Service Beacon features, including new contract types, filters, and interactions.

cards.name: Refineries
cards.description: The creation of mineral refinement facilities.
cards.body: The design, creation and implementation of locations where players can go to sell unrefined ore that they have mined. Players can also visit these facilities to purchase refined minerals to sell elsewhere.

cards.name: [FPS Combat] AI Combat Styles
cards.description: Implementing Combat Personalities
cards.body: Work on this feature will introduce a variety of Combat styles that can be applied to NPC AI. Some of these initial personalities would range from untrained fighters to trained military, allowing a variety of flavors to an encounter.

cards.name: [Flight] Combat Styles
cards.description: AI Pilot Combat Personalities
cards.body: This feature will introduce a variety of combat styles to AI Pilots. These personalities would vary in their approach to a combat scenario in order to make each combat encounter a little more unpredictable. This update will also allow AI ships to attack ground targets.

cards.name: Performance Optimization
cards.description: Ongoing performance improvements with specific quarterly goals to increase overall framerate among all PC specs.
cards.body: General optimization and engine improvements to increase stability and performance for the players. This includes continued transition of gameplay systems to Item 2.0 as well as investigation and resolution of possible memory leaks and performance spikes.
